New Records: The Atlanta Braves set a new MLB record with 282 home runs in the season, surpassing the previous mark of 277 set by the Los Angeles Dodgers in 2022.
The Braves are on pace to break the record with 312 home runs by the end of the season.
Key Match Events: The Braves clinched their sixth consecutive NL East title with a 4-1 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies on September 13, 2023.
Austin Riley hit a two-run homer in the first inning and added a sacrifice fly in the third inning to support Spencer Strider's strong pitching performance.
Pre-Game Insights: The Braves entered the game with a 17-game lead over the Phillies in the NL East standings, solidifying their dominance heading into the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Braves manager Brian Snitker emphasized the hard work and enjoyment of the victory, reminding players to savor the moment.
Players like Ronald Acuña Jr. and Matt Olson contributed significantly to the team's success, with Acuña Jr. expressing pride in the team's resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves' victory marked their second consecutive 100-win season, a remarkable achievement despite several injuries to key players.
The team's performance and history were celebrated, with references to their previous World Series victory in 2021.
